New Records: Colombia have now beaten Paraguay three straight times at Copa America, matching the longest winning run they've ever had against that opponent in the tournament.
Colombia have also won their opening game at four straight Copa America tournaments, their longest such streak since 1983 to 1993.
Key Match Events: GOAL: Paraguay score to halve deficit!

Colombia make their final subs as James Rodríguez, assistant of both of their goals, comes off to a great ovation alongside Jhon Arias. Juan Fernando Quintero and Kevin Castaño come on in their place. Paraguay make their final sub as well, surprisingly taking off Julio Enciso. Matías Rojas comes on in his stead.
Post-Match Reflections: Paraguay manager Daniel Garnero is upset about something and makes his feelings quite clear, earning himself a yellow card.
Colombia supporters showed out with attendance of 67,059, about 12,000 more than were here for Mexico vs Jamaica on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia look like the real deal with nine wins on the bounce and 24 matches since their last defeat.
The referee whistles for full time shortly after Paraguay's final shot is closer to clearing the stadium roof than troubling Colombia's goalkeeper.
